signals.Ask: We need to understand the specific use cases for Hiver from our marketing team.
signals.Evidence: I'm a little bit in the dark as to what the usage requirement would be.

signals.Ask: We need to ensure that Hiver complies with our IT policies before adoption.
signals.Evidence: We have to facilitate as it and make sure that it's compliant with all our policies.

signals.Ask: We require reporting capabilities to track response times and query management.
signals.Evidence: I think there are a few emails that go astray that just don't get covered.

signals.Ask: We need a clear timeline for implementing Hiver once a decision is made.
signals.Evidence: I haven't been given a strict deadline but... it's become sensitive that we've been getting queries about courses.

signals.Ask: We need to assess how many users will access shared inboxes across the organization.
signals.Evidence: I don't have any sense as to how many people and how many shared inboxes across the business in detail.

signals.Ask: We need the ability to create multiple shared inboxes under one Google account.
signals.Evidence: The only main thing that I could see is as a breaker there... you could only set up one shared inbox for each Google account.

signals.Ask: We require the ability to restrict access to certain inboxes for specific team members.
signals.Evidence: We have people that we don't need to have access to certain accounting emails.

signals.Ask: We need a mobile app experience that mirrors the desktop functionality, including shared labels.
signals.Evidence: The ideal scenario would be for us to have a mobile version of exactly what you're seeing right here.

signals.Ask: We want robust AI capabilities to automate our email workflows and improve efficiency.
signals.Evidence: We basically just want the ability to collaborate on emails is, I guess, is the... yeah.

signals.Ask: We need confirmation on whether Hiver can integrate with Google Groups for managing shared inboxes.
signals.Evidence: I guess what I'm getting at is does Google groups provide us with the ability to restrict access to certain inboxes.

signals.Ask: Hiver must integrate seamlessly with Hubspot, Slack, and Jira.
signals.Evidence: Hubspot is the most important; that will get us there.

signals.Ask: The solution should allow for internal tickets to be flagged and routed to the appropriate team members.
signals.Evidence: Is there a way for internal tickets to be flagged?

signals.Ask: Onboarding should be flexible, allowing for asynchronous training and not requiring all team members to be present.
signals.Evidence: Do you need everybody on a call for onboarding? Can it be asynchronous?

signals.Ask: The solution must provide cost savings compared to the current use of Front.
signals.Evidence: If we can save money and there's features that we're not using... it would make sense.

signals.Ask: There should be a straightforward process for migrating data from Front to Hiver.
signals.Evidence: What is the typical kind of pushback... on migrating that over?

signals.Ask: We need a system to manage personal and shared emails effectively.
signals.Evidence: I think we can... it could be a shared account.

signals.Ask: We require automation to categorize emails based on specific language.
signals.Evidence: Are there rules that we could set, that if there's certain language, it goes to a certain mailbox?

signals.Ask: We need to track response times and resolution times for compliance purposes.
signals.Evidence: If I wanted to see all the communications within one shot that I can navigate between all of them?

signals.Ask: We prefer a sandbox environment to test the system before full implementation.
signals.Evidence: Is there a test environment where we can try this instead of going live?

signals.Ask: We want to communicate internally about specific emails without confusion.
signals.Evidence: I want to be able to communicate internally with the teams to talk about certain emails.

signals.Ask: We need clarity on how to structure our client communications within Hiver.
signals.Evidence: We're trying to figure out what that structure might look like.

signals.Ask: Cost is a significant concern, and we want to avoid expensive plans.
signals.Evidence: We're also trying to see what can we do without like having to upgrade to the super expensive plans.

signals.Ask: We require automation to ensure emails are assigned correctly based on client associations.
signals.Evidence: What we don't want is like 100 unassigned emails every day.

signals.Ask: We want AI capabilities integrated into the system without additional costs.
signals.Evidence: It's included in most of the other software that we're looking at.

signals.Ask: We need flexible onboarding support without a set limit on meetings.
signals.Evidence: You tell us, we don't there's no like, oh, you get five meetings and nothing like that.

signals.Ask: We want a trial period to test the software before committing.
signals.Evidence: I can demo it and plug it in and start playing with it.

signals.Ask: We need options for a flexible contract or a trial period to avoid long-term commitments.
signals.Evidence: Are we set on a contract? Are we tied into it?

transcripts.title: Hiver & Sasha Hathaway with Winning by Design

signals.Ask: We need assistance in setting up AI tagging and automations for our support requests.
signals.Evidence: I would love to explore that and maybe have you walk me through how that works right now.

signals.Ask: Please extend our trial period by at least two weeks to finalize budget approval.
signals.Evidence: Is there a way to potentially add like two more weeks to that just so I can run this up the chain?

signals.Ask: Provide a clear breakdown of the total cost for the AI features for our team.
signals.Evidence: Can you just include the total price?

signals.Ask: We only need the AI features enabled for one email address, not all users.
signals.Evidence: I just need it set up so that it automates these responses.

signals.Ask: Clarify the process for training the AI with existing emails for tagging.
signals.Evidence: Can you go a little bit more into the training aspect and adding those emails to train it on that tag?

signals.Ask: We need support that includes ticketing, chat, and email management.
signals.Evidence: We are looking for a support that includes like ticketing and chat and really covering all emails from our customers.

signals.Ask: We require integration with Slack for ticket notifications.
signals.Evidence: Is there a way to integrate you guys to slack? Let's say that if there's a new ticket or a new request that is opening, it could also notify the team over slack.

signals.Ask: We need the ability to define maximum response times and SLAs for support tickets.
signals.Evidence: Is there a way to define like maximum time to response and stuff like that?

signals.Ask: We expect a dedicated customer success manager for onboarding and implementation.
signals.Evidence: We will provide you a dedicated customer success manager.

signals.Ask: We need clarity on pricing adjustments as our user base grows.
signals.Evidence: Is the price changes when the volume is higher or it still remains the same?

signals.Ask: We need a shared inbox solution that is easier to use than Hubspot.
signals.Evidence: Hubspot doesn't give us quite the ease of use that we need for handling shared inboxes.

signals.Ask: We require robust analytics and reporting capabilities to track email performance and customer interactions.
signals.Evidence: The analytics aren't quite there with our current setup.

signals.Ask: We need integration with Aircall and Slack for notifications and call management.
signals.Evidence: We have teams who don't necessarily live in their inbox, who are more on Slack.

signals.Ask: All team members must be on the same platform for effective use of the shared inbox.
signals.Evidence: It's an all or nothing thing; everyone would have to use work out of here.

signals.Ask: We need the ability to create custom reports based on specific tags and user interactions.
signals.Evidence: We want to understand when those people are emailing in, who they're talking to, and how many different people they are having touch points with.

signals.Ask: I need to be able to see what's happening in the sales inbox.
signals.Evidence: I need oversight and, but I don't need to be part of the round Robin.

signals.Ask: I need the ability to exclude certain users from the round robin.
signals.Evidence: Sometimes I have to assist or give information, right?

signals.Ask: I need confirmation that the exclusion feature will be released on time.
signals.Evidence: I want to be absolutely upfront with you and make sure that we're not just saying this.

signals.Ask: I would like to see a demonstration of the product's features.
signals.Evidence: I'd love to see it.

signals.Ask: I need assurance that my team will be fully set up and supported during implementation.
signals.Evidence: Make sure all of these workflows just making sure that your team is fully set up and implemented.

signals.Ask: We need a solution that simplifies managing high volumes of emails across multiple shared mailboxes.
signals.Evidence: It's a high volume and we find it quite difficult to kind of manage the inbox at the moment.

signals.Ask: The solution must integrate seamlessly with our Google Workspace environment.
signals.Evidence: We recently transitioned from O365 to Google about a month ago.

signals.Ask: We require the ability to create custom statuses for email tracking beyond just open, pending, and closed.
signals.Evidence: Can you create different statuses other than open pending and closed, for example, sent to it for review or sent for DocuSign?

signals.Ask: We need standard metrics like time to respond, time to resolution, and ticket volume by individual for performance tracking.
signals.Evidence: Just like I guess as a team like the kind of standard metrics like time to respond, time to resolution, like number of tickets by individuals?

signals.Ask: The solution must meet our security requirements and certifications, including ISO and HIPAA compliance.
signals.Evidence: Can you talk us through your kind of security posture and certifications?
